importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was last seen at her workplace on this date, marking the beginning of the investigation into her disappearance.
Two weeks after her disappearance, human remains were found in a shallow grave, signaling a significant development in the case.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period between Scott’s last known sighting and the discovery of remains is central to understanding the timeline of events and the suspect's potential involvement.

keyTakeAways: A 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing after being last seen at her workplace on October 4, 2025.
Human remains believed to be Scott’s were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in a wooded area, two weeks after her disappearance.
Suspect Keon King, 21, was arrested and charged with Scott’s kidnapping, as well as a previous kidnapping case involving a woman known to him, indicating a pattern of behavior.
Tracking of phone communications led investigators to King, who was the last person known to have contact with Scott before she went offline.
An anonymous tip led police to the grave site, and a separate public tip led them to a gold 1999 Toyota Camry, believed to be linked to King.
The case involves a suspected pattern of kidnapping and abuse, with King previously charged in a domestic incident that was later refiled.
The FBI’s Violent Crime Task Force is assisting the Philadelphia Police Department in the investigation.
Scott’s family has urged the public to come forward with any information, emphasizing that even small details could be crucial to solving the case.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman from Philadelphia who went missing on October 4, 2025, and whose remains were later found in a shallow grave.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the central figure in the investigation, and the discovery of her remains is a pivotal development in the case.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old man arrested and charged with kidnapping Kada Scott and previously charged with kidnapping another woman in a domestic incident.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the primary suspect in both the current and prior kidnapping cases, with phone records and video evidence suggesting contact with Scott before her disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Police Department
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The local law enforcement agency leading the investigation into Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They are conducting the primary investigation, including searching for evidence and coordinating with federal agencies.

namedEntities.name: FBI Violent Crime Task Force
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A federal law enforcement unit providing support to the Philadelphia Police Department in the investigation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They are assisting in the investigation, indicating the severity and complexity of the case.

namedEntities.name: John Stanford
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Philadelphia Police First Deputy Commissioner who provided updates on the case at a news conference.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He confirmed that the remains are being evaluated by the medical examiner and emphasized the importance of accountability for the case.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Assistant District Attorney who discussed the investigation and the suspect’s phone records.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She explained how phone tracking led to King and confirmed that he was the last person in contact with Scott.

namedEntities.name: Cherelle Parker
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Philadelphia Mayor who expressed support for Kada Scott’s family.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Her statement reflects city-level support and public acknowledgment of the emotional impact on the family.

namedEntities.name: Kim Matthews
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Mother of Kada Scott, who expressed fear and grief over her daughter’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Her personal statements highlight the emotional toll on the family and underscore public appeal for information.

namedEntities.name: Kevin Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Father of Kada Scott, who urged the public to provide information.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He emphasized that small pieces of information could be vital to solving the case.

namedEntities.name: Gold 1999 Toyota Camry
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A vehicle linked to suspect Keon King and believed to have been used in connection with Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It has been identified as potentially containing evidence and is currently being investigated after a public tip led to its location.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing on October 4, 2025, after being last seen at her workplace. Two weeks later, human remains believed to be hers were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school. Police identified Keon King, a 21-year-old man with a prior kidnapping charge, as a suspect based on phone records and video evidence showing contact with Scott. King was arrested and charged with her kidnapping, as well as a prior domestic kidnapping case involving another woman. Investigators believe King may have been involved in both cases, indicating a pattern of behavior. A key anonymous tip led police to the grave site, while another public tip led them to a gold 1999 Toyota Camry linked to King. The Philadelphia Police Department, with assistance from the FBI’s Violent Crime Task Force, is actively investigating the case. Scott’s family continues to urge the public to come forward with any information, emphasizing that even minor details could be crucial to solving the case.
title: Police Investigate Disappearance of Philadelphia Woman; Remains Found in Shallow Grave After Public Tip
